timeline.description_de: Einleitung zur Entscheidungsfindung und Kontext der Präsentation.
timeline.description_en: Introduction to decision-making and the context of the presentation.

timeline.description_de: Perspektiven sind wichtig für ein gemeinsames Verständnis.
timeline.description_en: Perspectives are important for a shared understanding.

timeline.description_de: Angenommener Kontext als Problem bei der Entscheidungsfindung.
timeline.description_en: Assumed context as a problem in decision-making.

timeline.description_de: Erörterung, warum es wichtig ist zu verstehen, warum Best Practices wann angewendet werden.
timeline.description_en: Discussion on why it is important to understand when and why best practices are applied.

timeline.description_de: Flattened-Metrics als Problem bei der Entscheidungsfindung.
timeline.description_en: Flattened metrics as a problem in decision-making.

timeline.description_de: Diskussion über Optimieren und Satisficing-Metriken für die Entscheidungsfindung.
timeline.description_en: Discussion on optimizing and satisficing metrics for decision-making.

timeline.description_de: Welche Perspektiven sind am wichtigsten für Entscheidungen?
timeline.description_en: Which perspectives are most important for decision-making?

timeline.description_de: Bedrohungen für Entscheidungen und deren Zustimmung.
timeline.description_en: Threats to decisions and their acceptance.

timeline.description_de: Einführung in Wahlmethoden (z.B. Mehrheitswahl) zur Entscheidungsfindung im Team-Kontext.
timeline.description_en: Introduction to voting methods (e.g., majority voting) for decision-making in a team context.

timeline.description_de: Risiko von Mehrheitsentscheidung - Tyrannei der Mehrheit.
timeline.description_en: Risk of majority decisions – tyranny of the majority.

timeline.description_de: Konsensfindung, Zustimmungsabfrage, Bewertungsabfrage und weitere als alternative Methoden.
timeline.description_en: Consensus building, approval polls, score polls, and other alternative methods.

timeline.description_de: Aussage, warum es entscheidend ist, den Kontext bei Entscheidungen zu berücksichtigen.
timeline.description_en: Statement on why it is crucial to consider context in decisions.

timeline.description_de: Die Perspektiven/Personen finden, die für eine Entscheidung relevant sind.
timeline.description_en: Identifying the perspectives/individuals relevant for a decision.

timeline.description_de: Vorteile neuer Perspektiven; neue Informationen und reichere Entscheidungen.
timeline.description_en: Benefits of new perspectives; new information and richer decisions.

timeline.description_de: Zusammenfassung - Mehrwert von Perspektiven, insbesondere den versteckten.
timeline.description_en: Summary – Value of perspectives, particularly hidden ones.

quotes.text: Context informs the perspectives with which all of it was built.
quotes.author: Chelsea Troy

quotes.text: Computer science is not like other sciences; it is entirely human-made.
quotes.author: Chelsea Troy

quotes.text: When we are responsible for teaching other people statements that start with generally [...] we are responsible for knowing what generally means.
quotes.author: Chelsea Troy

quotes.text: It is very easy not to realize context is there.
quotes.author: Chelsea Troy

quotes.text: If you can describe the tradeoffs of the technical choices you are making, you'll be several steps ahead of the best practice conversation.
quotes.author: Chelsea Troy

quotes.text: The perspectives that matter the most in decision-making are precisely those perspectives that typically get excluded from participation in the thing we are making a decision about.
quotes.author: Chelsea Troy

quotes.text: We need to eliminate fear of exclusion by making all candidates acceptable.
quotes.author: Chelsea Troy

quotes.text: Any perspective we bring to the problem comes with a specific, sometimes hidden, context that we need to compare against other perspectives and contexts.
quotes.author: Chelsea Troy

quotes.text: Most of the time, not all concerns are equal. Acceptable and preferential are not the same.
quotes.author: Chelsea Troy
